items.title: Enum Data Type resolution in pyang tree output
AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'i_identities'
items.body:
See the following example model:
[example.zip](https://github.com/mbj4668/pyang/files/4850484/example.zip)

This fails in pyang with the following exception:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/verthezp/local/pyang/pyang-pyang-2.3.0/bin/pyang", line 533, in <module>
    run()
  File "/home/verthezp/local/pyang/pyang-pyang-2.3.0/bin/pyang", line 401, in run
    ctx.validate()
  File "/home/verthezp/local/pyang/pyang-pyang-2.3.0/pyang/context.py", line 331, in validate
    statements.validate_module(self, m)
  File "/home/verthezp/local/pyang/pyang-pyang-2.3.0/pyang/statements.py", line 413, in validate_module
    iterate(module, phase)
  File "/home/verthezp/local/pyang/pyang-pyang-2.3.0/pyang/statements.py", line 408, in iterate
    iterate(s, phase)
  File "/home/verthezp/local/pyang/pyang-pyang-2.3.0/pyang/statements.py", line 370, in iterate
    res = f(ctx, stmt)
  File "/home/verthezp/local/pyang/pyang-pyang-2.3.0/pyang/statements.py", line 207, in <lambda>
    ('type_2', 'leaf'):lambda ctx, s: v_type_leaf(ctx, s),
  File "/home/verthezp/local/pyang/pyang-pyang-2.3.0/pyang/statements.py", line 1015, in v_type_leaf
    defval, ' for the default value')
  File "/home/verthezp/local/pyang/pyang-pyang-2.3.0/pyang/types.py", line 1022, in validate
    t_val = t.i_type_spec.str_to_val([], pos, val, module)
  File "/home/verthezp/local/pyang/pyang-pyang-2.3.0/pyang/types.py", line 266, in str_to_val
    if name not in pmodule.i_identities:
AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'i_identities'

It looks like some calls in statements.py to the validate method are actually missing the module argument, so in the above case " for the default value" is taken as module, causing the exception.

This is failing in 2.3.0, and was apparently also already failing in 2.2.1.   In 1.7.5 it was succeeding.

items.title: config false deviation not working when leaf did not mention config true explicitly
items.body:
See the following example model:
[example.zip](https://github.com/mbj4668/pyang/files/4850451/example.zip)

This fails to validate with the following error:
example.yang:8: error: the "config" property does not exist in node "example::someleaf"

It looks like the deviation fails because someleaf does not explicitly have 'config true'. 

But according to the YANG RFC, 'config true' is implied when it is not present (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7950#section-7.21.1)

This is failing newly in 2.3.0.   It was succeeding in 2.2.1 and 1.7.5

items.title: problem in matching default to string pattern
items.body:
See the following model:
[example.zip](https://github.com/mbj4668/pyang/files/4850425/example.zip)

This fails to validate in pyang with:
example.yang:15: error: the value "" does not match its base type at example.yang:5 - pattern mismatch  for pattern defined at example.yang:8

The pattern seems to be valid however (according to https://www.w3.org/TR/2004/REC-xmlschema-2-20041028/#charcter-classes) and the default value "" seems to match it.

items.title: jstree HTML output: "action" parameters are not expanded, just listed as tooltip
items.body:
As per the subject

Generating the HTML view with the --jstree option, while for "rpc" the input and output parameters are expanded and visibile as any other data tree node, this is not happening for the "action" statement

In the HTML tree view, the "action" is reported as expected in the datatree, but there is a generic "parameters" type and nothing else. 

To see which are the input and output parameters defined for the action, the only way is hovering the "parameters" type and then the tooltip simply summarizes "in" and "out" nodes - that's it.  See the attached screenshot:

![Action1-pyang](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15357944/85730951-602f1900-b6fa-11ea-97fc-52a0d8a6278a.png)

It would be definitely useful if also the "action" is expanded in the HTML jstree view exactly as it is done for "rpc", i.e. as expandable/collapsible nodes like that:

![Action2-Window](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15357944/85731028-73da7f80-b6fa-11ea-8336-be0382196309.png)

items.title: Next release cut?
items.body: Selfishly wondering when the next release of pyang will be cut, specifically so I can `pip install pyang` for the `flatten` plugin instead of eggs and GitHub. :) Not a rush, but interested!

items.title: Share my Experience of Installing pyang on Windows Platform
items.body:
Hi, I find it is easier to use "Git Bash"  to use `pyang` on windows. 

1. Download "Git on Windows" on https://gitforwindows.org/ and install as normally as other windows software (double click and next step). 

2. Install `python`. I installed latest python 3.8.  Just ensure to check "Add python 3.8 to PATH" if one does not have good experience of using python. 
NOTE: virtualenv is a good option if one is an experienced user. 

3. Install `python` using `pip install pyang`

4. How-to-use: (Optionally, open the directory with pyang files) Right click , and choose "Git Bash Here", test run `pyang -h`. 

If any issue, check the python PATH is correct in **system variables** configuration.

Dear 
Could you add absolute-schema-nodeid support on flatten mode ?
ab-l3vpn is module name ,l3vpn is prefix.
the current output 
pyang -f flatten ab-l3vpn@2020-03-03.yang

/ab-l3vpn:configuration

/ab-l3vpn:configuration/vrf/vrf-instances

add absolute-schema-nodeid support 
pyang -f flatten ab-l3vpn@2020-03-03.yang

/l3vpn:configuration
/l3vpn:configuration/l3vpn:vrf

So it's easy to integrate to other yang  system . etc NSO.


Thanks
Hao Huang

items.title: Questions about the choice’s "case" Statement
unexpected keyword can be used within the "augment" statement
Incorrect counting of ..
items.body:
With modules from the directory

https://github.com/CZ-NIC/yangson/tree/master/yang-modules/test

pyang gives the following error:
```
$ pyang test@2016-04-26.yang testb.yang 
defs@2016-04-26.yang:47: error: the path for typE at defs@2016-04-26.yang:45 has too many ".."
```
This appears to be wrong given that `typedef typE` is referenced from `test:leafW`, its definition is
```
  typedef typE {
    type leafref {
      path "../../leafB";
    }
  }
```
and the schema tree is as follows:
```
+--rw (test:choiA)?
|  +--:(test:caseA)
```

[example.zip](https://github.com/mbj4668/pyang/files/4573228/example.zip)

items.title: A definition of "current" reference a "deprecated" or "obsolete" definition within the same module.
A notification MUST NOT be defined within an rpc, action, or another notification
An action MUST NOT be defined within an rpc, another action, or a notification
There MUST NOT be any mandatory nodes directly under the   default case.
pyang wrongly rejects substring function with 2 arguments
items.body:
See the attached yang model
[example.zip](https://github.com/mbj4668/pyang/files/4509710/example.zip)

It has a must constraint "substring(., 2) = 'test'" which is rejected by pyang 2.2.1 with the following error:

"example.yang:10: error: XPath function "substring" takes 3-4 arguments but called with 2."

This is completely wrong, the substring function has 2-3 arguments, not 3-4.   See https://www.w3.org/TR/1999/REC-xpath-19991116/#section-String-Functions

items.title: pyang will crash when "input" statement defined in anydata node.
The target node of "augment" statement is "action" node.
The default value in leaf-list node MUST NOT be marked with an if-feature statement
pyang crash because of no validating the value of position in the "bit" statement
illegal length restriction is not checked by pyang of 2.2.1
illegal range restriction is not checked by pyang of 2.2.1
pyang crash because of no validating the value of min-elements in the "augment" statement
pyang crash because of no validating the value of min-elements when the "default" statement is present
--ietf  erroneously reports that 8174 text is missing
items.body: If a module has the 8174 text, but also a description in an 'import', pyang --ietf will report that the 8174 text is missing.

items.title: The definition of the default value should NOT be marked with an "if-feature" statement.
Package __init__ contains code; imports a lot
items.body:
The pyang/__init__.py module contains the implementation for module repository, and its context. To that end, it imports several modules, which in turn pull in most of pyang. 

This means, that each import pyang, imports all of it in effect. All of the imports except grammar.py are used by the implemented classes. It is unclear, if the imports were meant to provide a convenience API to just import pyang in client code instead of individual modules the client code uses.

In case of package requirements like lxml, the current code cannot import them normally, as setup.py would fail in case the dependency is missing - all the while setup.py is supposed to declare the dependency as a target for installation.

The suggestion is to move the code into a separate repository.py module. Thus only `__version__` and `__date__` would remain. A potential side effect is for 3-rd party code that relies on just importing pyang, this would be a breaking change.

items.title: Yang Deprecated node
items.body:
Hi,

Pyang is not able to decode deprecated node properly. If a container/List is deprecated, all leaf/leaf-list present inside that will also be deprecated automatically. But the pyang tree output is not giving that result. It is just showing a Container/List as "x--" in yang tree but all the nodes inside that is showing as "+--" which is not correct.
Can you please let me know if the problem is fixed or yet to be fixed.

items.title: An action MUST NOT have any ancestor node that is a list node without a "key" statement
Interacting with Juniper models
items.body:
I'm able to generate a tree representation of Juniper models fine as long as I set the path properly, but for whatever reason bindings and jtox files that I attempt to create with them end up incomplete, although pyang itself does not throw any errors.

Tree command:

`pyang -f tree conf/junos-ex-conf-interfaces@2018-01-01.yang -p ../`

jtox command:

`pyang -f jtox -o ~/juniper_ints.jtox conf/junos-ex-conf-interfaces@2018-01-01.yang -p ../`

Running the jtox command does not throw an error, but the jtox file is basically empty except for the import declarations from junos-ex-conf-interfaces@2018-01-01.yang:

```{"tree": {}, "modules": {"junos-ex-conf-root": ["jc", "http://yang.juniper.net/junos-ex/conf/root"], "junos-ex-conf-interfaces": ["jc-interfaces", "http://yang.juniper.net/junos-ex/conf/interfaces"], "junos-common-ddl-extensions": ["junos", "http://yang.juniper.net/junos/common/ddl-extensions"], "junos-common-types": ["jt", "http://yang.juniper.net/junos/common/types"]}, "annotations": {}}```

The same thing happens when I try to create a pybind file from Juniper models. The .py file ends up tiny, with just a few lines in it.

Is there something I'm missing here?

```
{ version info:

ibarrere@rigel junos-ex % python --version
Python 2.7.16
ibarrere@rigel junos-ex % pyang --version
pyang 2.1.1
ibarrere@rigel junos-ex %

}
```

items.title: pyang rejects import prefix in leaf default statement
items.body:
Scenario: Module B imports module A and specifies different prefix in the import statement than the one defined in module A (not recommended but allowed by YANG RFC 6020).
Then, module B tries to provide a default value for a leaf of type T, using the prefix defined in the import statement.

Pyang outputs an error:

> B.yang:11: error: prefix "prefA2" is not defined (reported only once)

Please see the attachments for reference.

[A.yang.txt](https://github.com/mbj4668/pyang/files/4123717/A.yang.txt)
[B.yang.txt](https://github.com/mbj4668/pyang/files/4123718/B.yang.txt)
(tried to upload .yang files but the form forced me to upload .txt files)

Tested on pyang 2.1.1.

items.title: -f yang --keep-comments should print end-of-line comments better
if-feature statements should do the status check for each feature
items.body:
Hi Martin,

As we know
> If a definition is "current", it MUST NOT reference a "deprecated" or
   "obsolete" definition within the same module.
    If a definition is "deprecated", it MUST NOT reference an "obsolete"
   definition within the same module.

But I find the if-feature statment will not check the features' status within the if-feature statement.

I will commit a PR for this issue. And there will be some testcases there.

items.title: Any tab char in a succeeding line that must be examined for stripping should be converted into 8 space characters
items.body:
@mbj4668 
Hi, Martin
I find an issue in YANG read quoted string for TAB char for convert.

As is described in [RFC7950 section 6.1.3](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7950#section-6.1.3) 

> If a double-quoted string contains a line break followed by space or
   tab characters that are used to indent the text according to the
   layout in the YANG file, this leading whitespace is stripped from the
   string, up to and including the column of the starting double quote
   character, or to the first non-whitespace character, whichever occurs
   first.  Any tab character in a succeeding line that must be examined
   for stripping is first converted into 8 space characters.

But I find that pyang didn't do this convert( One tab character into 8 space characters ).

I have made a PR( #544 ) for this issue.

And I add some testcases for this.

Please review this, Thanks.

items.title: env.sh fails if path contains spaces
items.body:
This is a minor issue, but also has a minor fix.

If PATH contains spaces, env.sh will fail.
Spaces in PATH are generally avoided, but that is harder when running under WSL (where windows injects its PATH into the WSL environment PATH).

If env.sh uses PATH (and other similar variables) in quotes, the issue no longer happens.

    p=`pwd`
    export PATH="$p/bin:$PATH"
    export MANPATH="$p/man:$MANPATH"
    export PYTHONPATH="$p:$PYTHONPATH"
    export YANG_MODPATH="$p/modules:$YANG_MODPATH"
    export PYANG_XSLT_DIR="$p/xslt"
    export PYANG_RNG_LIBDIR="$p/schema"
    export W="$p"

items.title: Different "yin conversion" behavior for "if-feature" between pyang1.7.8 and pyang2.1
items.body:
Unzip the attached file

[if-feature.zip](https://github.com/mbj4668/pyang/files/3981457/if-feature.zip)

Then run below command with pyang 1.7.8

> **pyang -f yin bak.yang -p . -F "smp:forwarding-databases,mac-learning"**

The result will be 

```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<module name="bak"
        xmlns="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:yang:yin:1"
        xmlns:bak="http://tail-f.com/ns/example/bak"
        xmlns:bbf-l2-fwd="http://tail-f.com/ns/example/smp">
  <yang-version value="1.1"/>
  <namespace uri="http://tail-f.com/ns/example/bak"/>
  <prefix value="bak"/>
  <import module="smp">
    <prefix value="bbf-l2-fwd"/>
  </import>
  <feature name="bak"/>
  <augment target-node="/bbf-l2-fwd:forwarding/bbf-l2-fwd:forwarding-databases/bbf-l2-fwd:forwarding-database/bbf-l2-fwd:static-mac-address/bbf-l2-fwd:learning-constraint/bbf-l2-fwd:allowed-to-learn-on/bbf-l2-fwd:allow-to-learn-on">
    <if-feature name="bbf-l2-fwd:forwarding-databases and bbf-l2-fwd:mac-learning"/>
  </augment>
</module>

```

While running same command with pyang 2.1, the result will be 

```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<module name="bak"
        xmlns="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:yang:yin:1"
        xmlns:bak="http://tail-f.com/ns/example/bak"
        xmlns:bbf-l2-fwd="http://tail-f.com/ns/example/smp">
  <yang-version value="1.1"/>
  <namespace uri="http://tail-f.com/ns/example/bak"/>
  <prefix value="bak"/>
  <import module="smp">
    <prefix value="bbf-l2-fwd"/>
  </import>
  <feature name="bak"/>
  <augment target-node="/bbf-l2-fwd:forwarding/bbf-l2-fwd:forwarding-databases/bbf-l2-fwd:forwarding-database/bbf-l2-fwd:static-mac-address/bbf-l2-fwd:learning-constraint/bbf-l2-fwd:allowed-to-learn-on/bbf-l2-fwd:allow-to-learn-on">
    <if-feature name="bbf-l2-fwd:forwarding-databases and bbf-l2-fwd:mac-learning"/>
    <case name="ethernet-interfaces">
      <if-feature name="bbf-l2-fwd:shared-forwarding-databases"/>
      <container name="interface-references">
        <leaf-list name="interface">
          <type name="string"/>
        </leaf-list>
        <leaf name="dev-target">
          <type name="string"/>
        </leaf>
      </container>
    </case>
  </augment>
</module>

```

From my point of view it seems 1.7.8 gives the corret output, i.e. branches under "if-feature bbf-l2-fwd:shared-forwarding-databases" have been removed, cause the feature "bbf-l2-fwd:shared-forwarding-databases" is implicitly disabled. Why 2.1 still keeps them?

items.title: HelloParser not handling deviations?
items.body:
EDIT: Should deviations be advertised as their own capability?

I see `deviations` specified in hello messages for instance: https://github.com/YangModels/yang/blob/master/vendor/cisco/xr/701/capabilities-ncs5k.xml#L7

These deviations do not seem to be sourced perusing [`hello.py`](https://github.com/mbj4668/pyang/blob/master/pyang/hello.py).

items.title: statements data_keywords vs data_definition_keywords
items.body:
What is the difference between [`statements.data_keywords`](https://github.com/mbj4668/pyang/blob/4435dfec9396c9c1f3ef6b3c22e4f804a6051f92/pyang/statements.py#L288-L289) and [`statements.data_definition_keywords`](https://github.com/mbj4668/pyang/blob/4435dfec9396c9c1f3ef6b3c22e4f804a6051f92/pyang/statements.py#L120-L121)? `statements.data_keywords` seems broader - would everything being in `data_keywords` have an XPath?

For instance - here if we filter by keyword...
```python
statement_children = (
    child
    for child in statement.i_children
    if child.keyword in statements.data_definition_keywords
)
```

Should filtering happen on `data_keywords` or `data_definition_keywords`?

Blocks #519

items.title: invalid unused-module warning
items.body:
Some modules (e.g., `ietf-ssh-server`) may need to import another module (e.g., `ietf-crypto-types`) only in order to prefix an `identity` used in a `must` expression.   However, the sole use of the prefix inside a `must` expression apparently does not constitute a "use" and `pyang` complains:

`warning: imported module "ietf-crypto-types" not used`

items.title: [Question] Generating Schematron always results in exslt which has experimental support.
items.body:
Whenever I use yang2dsdl to geneate a .sch schema, the resulting file is of the following format:

`<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<sch:schema xmlns:sch="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron" queryBinding="`**exslt**`">`

As stated in iso_schematron_skeleton_for_xslt1.xsl, exslt has an experimental support. How can I make sure that xslt will be generated instead of exslt, so that the .sch will look like:
`<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<sch:schema xmlns:sch="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron" queryBinding="`**xslt**`">`

items.title: Modules not matched in schema node identifiers
items.body:
For statements like `deviation` whose argument is a schema node identifier, when an identifier in the path has a prefix from its defining module but belongs to a grouping used by a different module, `find_target_node` fails to match the child for the prefixed identifier.

For an example, see the attached file deviation-test.yang. It contains a deviation to `.../oc-if:subinterface/oc-ip:ipv4/oc-if:unnumbered/...`. If I download the OpenConfig models using `git clone https://github.com/openconfig/public openconfig` and run `pyang -p openconfig deviation-test.yang -f yang -o deviation-test.yang`, I get the message:
```
deviation-test.yang:12: error: node openconfig-interfaces::unnumbered is not found
```

However, if I alter the path to be `.../oc-ip:ipv4/oc-ip:unnumbered/oc-ip:config/oc-ip:enabled` (replacing every prefix under oc-ip:ipv4 with "oc-ip"), pyang runs with no errors.

A statement that seems to be at the center of the problem is https://github.com/mbj4668/pyang/blob/086fc29d/pyang/statements.py#L1551. Every statement for a node in a grouping has i_module set to the module where it is used. That makes sense for the XML namespaces of nodes, but not for schema node identifiers.

A point of comparison: When I run [goyang](https://github.com/openconfig/goyang) on the same modules (`goyang --format=tree --path openconfig openconfig/release/models/interfaces/openconfig-interfaces.yang  openconfig/release/models/interfaces/openconfig-if-ip.yang`), it identifies the same node as "oc-if:unnumbered", not "oc-ip:".

[deviation-test.yang](https://github.com/mbj4668/pyang/files/3719770/deviation-test.yang.txt)

In my design, I make this plugin to registeer a new output format :
```
def add_output_format(self, fmts):
      self.multiple_modules = True
      fmts['feature-yang'] = self
```

Now I have finished the parsing logics in this plugin, I already put the needed data for the yang file which I need to generate, into the proper data structures. These data include, E.g.:
1. module name, namespace, prefix
2. all the modules need to be imported
3. all the groupings need to be defined
4. all the groupings need to be augmented

In this case,  is there any class/method in pyang, I can use in order to generate the target yang file ?

Thanks in advance.

Ambiguous error message for added/deleted presence node
items.body:
#### Symptoms
When checking backward compatibility of a module, which has added/deleted presence node, the error message is ambiguous - having quotes on presence statement. Instead it should quote only affected parent node.
#### How to reproduce
Compare IOS XR 652 module Cisco-IOS-XR-ip-tcp-cfg.yang to corresponding module in 633:
```
$ pyang --check-update-from ../633/Cisco-IOS-XR-ip-tcp-cfg.yang -P ../633 Cisco-IOS-XR-ip-tcp-cfg.yang
Cisco-IOS-XR-ip-tcp-cfg.yang:85: error: the base type has illegally changed from int32 to uint32
Cisco-IOS-XR-ip-tcp-cfg.yang:160: error: the presence 'Indicates a ip-tcp node is configured.' is illegally added
Cisco-IOS-XR-ip-tcp-cfg.yang:342: error: the base type has illegally changed from int32 to uint32
Cisco-IOS-XR-ip-tcp-cfg.yang:367: error: a new must expression cannot be added
```
Note ambiguously quoted error message:
**the presence 'Indicates a ip-tcp node is configured.' is illegally added**
#### Expected behavior
It is expected to have the following message:
**the presence 'ip-tcp' is illegally added**

items.title: pyang does not validate Xpath expression
items.body:
I have a must statement like this:

must "current( = 'xpdr'" {
    error-message "The only node-type supported is xpdr";
}

Looks like Pyang does not report any error and my yang gets converted to Yin without issues.

   <must condition="current( = 'xpdr'">
        <error-message>
          <value>The only node-type supported is xpdr</value>
        </error-message>
      </must>

Please clarify if this is expected?

items.title: In some error messages the YANG node names appear without quotes
items.body: In some error messages the Yang node names appear without quotes. That makes it hard to read error messages especially when YANG node names blend to regular English words.

items.title: The check_update plugin API is not suitable for apps
items.body:
The check_update plugin API is not suitable for apps where the existing functionality can be used on multiple modules without reloading the context. (Current implementation allows only single module compatibility check).
The main issues:
- [ ] The model context created each time the plugin function 'check_update' is invoked. Need to split the 'check_update' function to separate module comparison (ex.: 'chk_module') after context is created and checked. That would create an API for multiple use of the context to check compatibility for multiple modules.
- [ ] When parsing single module the algorithm removes all 'i_children' from statement, which makes it impossible for the context to be used multiple times.

items.title: pyang -f tree rendering issue with --tree-no-expand-uses
items.body:
In the tree diagram in [Section 2.1 of draft-ietf-netconf-restconf-client-server-11](https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-netconf-restconf-client-server-11#section-2.1) you will see `+---u restconf-client-grouping` twice.

Similarly, in the tree diagram in [Section 3.1 of the same draft](https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-netconf-restconf-client-server-11#section-3.1) you will see `+---u restconf-server-grouping` twice.

Neither of these are correct.  The "restconf-client/server-grouping" that is being printed is the names of the grouping that's its contained in, not the name of the groupings that are being used!

If you looking that the expanded tree diagrams in Appendix A (or the YANG modules), you'll see that there should be 3 groupings printed. E.g. restconf-client-grouping has:

                 uses tcpc:tcp-client-grouping {...}
                 uses tlsc:tls-client-grouping {...}
                 uses httpc:http-client-grouping{...}

The commands I'm using are:

 ``` 
pyang -p ../ -f tree --tree-line-length 69 --tree-print-groupings --tree-no-expand-uses ietf-restconf-client\@*.yang

 pyang -p ../ -f tree --tree-line-length 69 --tree-print-groupings --tree-no-expand-uses ietf-restconf-server\@*.yang
```

PS: This issue report regards -11 of the draft, but I plan to submit -12 today of tomorrow.  That version also has similar issues, but due to the way that I collapsed the "demux containers", it results in a different unexpected result.

PPS: As mentioned in #481, it would be a PITA to extract all the modules that ietf-restconf-server depends on.  A small test-case would be idea, but I don't have time to put one together (sorry!)

items.title: tree prints augmentation under a node disabled by a feature
items.body:
ietf-restconf-server augments "certs-maps" into ietf-tls-server:client-authentication/local-or-external/local, which is a "case" statement controlled by an if-feature (if-feature "local-client-auth-supported").

Using pyang to generate the tree *without* "local-client-auth-supported" defined (e.g., something like `pyang --features=ietf-tls-server:external-client-auth-supported  -f tree  ...`) produces a funny result:

```
<snip/>
  |        |        |  +--rw client-authentication!
  |        |        |     +--rw (required-or-optional)
  |        |        |     |  +--<snip/>
  |        |        |     +--rw (local-or-external)
  |        |        |        +--:(external)
  |        |        |        |        {external-client-auth-supported}?
  |        |        |        |  +--rw client-auth-defined-elsewhere?
  |        |        |        |          empty
  |        |        |        +--rw local
  |        |        |           +--rw cert-maps
  |        |        |              +--rw cert-to-name* [id]
  |        |        |                 +--rw id             uint32
  |        |        |                 +--rw fingerprint
  |        |        |                 |       x509c2n:tls-fingerprint
  |        |        |                 +--rw map-type       identityref
  |        |        |                 +--rw name           string
<snip/>
```

Note that the `local` is printed (not `:(local)`) and also the `{local-client-auth-supported}?` feature indication is missing.   

It appears that pyang correctly excludes the disabled case node and its descendants, but apparently before accounting for the augmentation.

PS: this regarding drafts that I'm about to submit (today or tomorrow) but, even it they were checked in, it would be a PITA to extract all the modules that ietf-restconf-server depends on.  A small test-case would be idea, but I don't have time to put one together (sorry!)

items.title: Convert YANG to XML

items.body:

== Validating grammar and datatypes ...

dyn:evaluate() : unable to evaluate expression '/en:notification/org-openroadm-device:org-openroadm-device/org-openroadm-device:users/babu:user[org-openroadm-device:name='test']'
--- Failed assert at "/en:notification/org-openroadm-device:change-notification/org-openroadm-device:edit/org-openroadm-device:target":
    The instance "/en:notification/org-openroadm-device:org-openroadm-device/org-openroadm-device:users/babu:user[org-openroadm-device:name='test']" must exist.
--- Failed assert at "/en:notification/org-openroadm-device:change-notification/org-openroadm-device:edit/org-openroadm-device:target":
    The instance "/en:notification/org-openroadm-device:org-openroadm-device/org-openroadm-device:users/org-openroadm-device:user[org-openroadm-device:name='test']/org-openroadm-device:group" must exist.
root@Attella-ODL-Server:/home/attella/orm_2_2_1#
root@Attella-ODL-Server:/home/attella/orm_2_2_1#

items.title: new boilerplate validation too literal
items.body:
Happy to see this addition, but it's flagging my modules unnecessarily because the line-returns are in different locations.

I believe the versions I have are better looking, but it would be best if the check could insensitive to where endings are located.

BTW, the "XXXX" assumes that the particular draft is using "XXXX" to represent the assign number for the current draft.  It's a safe guess, but not guaranteed.  Will the validator throw an error if the author chose a different placeholder value?   

FWIW, that last comment is a problem for me now as my folding script uses "XXXX" (for the artwork-folding draft) *and* the draft itself uses "XXXX" (to represent itself).  Since I've already moved to using "AAAA", "BBBB", "CCCC", etc. for imports, I was thinking about maybe doing the same for the main draft.  I probably won't, but I don't want the reason to be because a tool forced me.

**pyang**:
```
     The key words 'MUST', 'MUST NOT', 'REQUIRED', 'SHALL', 'SHALL
     NOT', 'SHOULD', 'SHOULD NOT', 'RECOMMENDED', 'NOT RECOMMENDED',
     'MAY', and 'OPTIONAL' in this document are to be interpreted as
     described in BCP 14 (RFC 2119) (RFC 8174) when, and only when,
     they appear in all capitals, as shown here.
```
**mine**:
```
     The key words 'MUST', 'MUST NOT', 'REQUIRED', 'SHALL',
     'SHALL NOT', 'SHOULD', 'SHOULD NOT', 'RECOMMENDED',
     'NOT RECOMMENDED', 'MAY', and 'OPTIONAL' in this document
     are to be interpreted as described in BCP 14 (RFC2119)
     (RFC8174) when, and only when, they appear in all
     capitals, as shown here.
```


**pyang**:
```
     Copyright (c) <year> IETF Trust and the persons identified as
     authors of the code.  All rights reserved.

     Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or
     without modification, is permitted pursuant to, and subject to
     the license terms contained in, the Simplified BSD License set
     forth in Section 4.c of the IETF Trust's Legal Provisions
     Relating to IETF Documents
     (https://trustee.ietf.org/license-info).

     This version of this YANG module is part of RFC XXXX
     (https://www.rfc-editor.org/info/rfcXXXX); see the RFC itself
     for full legal notices.
```
**mine**:
```
     Copyright (c) 2019 IETF Trust and the persons identified
     as authors of the code. All rights reserved.

     Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with
     or without modification, is permitted pursuant to, and
     subject to the license terms contained in, the Simplified
     BSD License set forth in Section 4.c of the IETF Trust's
     Legal Provisions Relating to IETF Documents
     (https://trustee.ietf.org/license-info).
  
     This version of this YANG module is part of RFC XXXX
     (https://www.rfc-editor.org/info/rfcXXXX); see the RFC
     itself for full legal notices.
```

items.title: Honor ABNF grammar for deviate delete substatements
ietf-modules/ietf-inet-types.yang:361: error: keyword "length" not in canonical order (see RFC 6020, Section 12)
items.body:
$ pyang --canonical ietf-inet-types@2013-07-15.yang
ietf-inet-types@2013-07-15.yang:361: error: keyword "length" not in canonical order (see RFC 6020, Section 12)

Swapping the "length" and "pattern" statements resolves the error, but RFC 6020 says "these stmts can appear in any order":
```
   string-restrictions = ;; these stmts can appear in any order
                         [length-stmt stmtsep]
                         *(pattern-stmt stmtsep)
```                                                

As does RFC 7950:
```
   string-restrictions = ;; these stmts can appear in any order
                         [length-stmt]
                         *pattern-stmt
```

items.title: pyang check-update does raise error when a range statement is added
pyang check-update-from errors when moving content to submodule
pre_validate_ctx not called at correct time
items.body:
The docstring for the `pre_validate_ctx` hook in `PyangPlugin` says:

    def pre_validate_ctx(self, ctx, modules):
        """Called for all plugins, before the modules are validated"""
        return

And indeed if you look at the [main script](https://github.com/mbj4668/pyang/blob/master/bin/pyang#L365) it looks like this hook is called before `ctx.validate()` is called.

However, this is not actually where the modules are validated. They are validated [as they are loaded](https://github.com/mbj4668/pyang/blob/master/pyang/__init__.py#L135) in `add_parsed_module`. All that [`ctx.validate`](https://github.com/mbj4668/pyang/blob/master/pyang/__init__.py#L331) does is check for duplicate namespaces.

This impacts the tailf plugin, which tries to do some pre-processing in pre_validate_ctx. (I could be wrong about this - maybe it really is supposed to be after validating modules)

items.title: XPath syntax error: Literal
items.body:
Hello Dears,

i try to parse Huawei yang models by pyang. I tested another Netconf client and it parsed and passed with warnings instead of errors. But pyang display those errors:

data/session/nr8xm6al6etlfukn59tqb45z4rxkcl5s/huawei-arp@2018-06-11.yang:553: error: XPath syntax error: Literal true from path is not of type enumeration
data/session/nr8xm6al6etlfukn59tqb45z4rxkcl5s/huawei-bfd-deviations-ATN-980B@2018-06-11.yang:421: error: XPath syntax error: Literal VXLAN from path is not of type enumeration
data/session/nr8xm6al6etlfukn59tqb45z4rxkcl5s/huawei-bfd-deviations-ATN-980B@2018-06-11.yang:426: error: XPath syntax error: Literal VXLAN from path is not of type enumeration
data/session/nr8xm6al6etlfukn59tqb45z4rxkcl5s/huawei-bfd-deviations-ATN-980B@2018-06-11.yang:431: error: XPath syntax error: Literal VXLAN from path is not of type enumeration
data/session/nr8xm6al6etlfukn59tqb45z4rxkcl5s/huawei-bgp-bgpcomm@2018-06-11.yang:319: error: XPath syntax error: Literal _public_ from path is not of type leafref
data/session/nr8xm6al6etlfukn59tqb45z4rxkcl5s/huawei-bgp-bgpcomm@2018-06-11.yang:326: error: XPath syntax error: Literal _public_ from path is not of type leafref

How could i upload those models

Thanks.
